intro: Erica platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Erica platycalyx is evergreen, with dense, leathery foliage that forms low, compact shrubs. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
